snippet: In response to employee whistle-blowers, the Department of Veterans Affairs has made clear over the years that it would not hesitate to retaliate, disciplining and even firing those who spoke up.
abstract: Interviews and internal documents reveal that staff members at dozens of Department of Veterans Affairs hospitals across country were disciplined or even fired after raising concerns over improper practices; growing scandal over long patient wait times and fake scheduling books has emboldened hundreds of employees to go to federal watchdogs, unions and outside whistle-blower groups to report continuing problems and culture of reprisals, silence and intimidation.
lead_paragraph: In response to employee whistle-blowers, the Department of Veterans Affairs has made clear over the years that it would not hesitate to retaliate, disciplining and even firing those who spoke up.
